comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

Copy a short part of the web page, click File / Print, choosing Adobe PDF, pasting the former copy part in the naming field, freezes Firefox 4.


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. surfing e.g. to mozilla.org
2. selecting "Weʼre Building a Better Internet" from that web page, rightclick selected text and choose copy
3. click on Menu File / Print, select Adobe PDF
4. File dialog is shown
5. pasting text from the clipboard by rightclick / past
6. Firefox stopps responding immediately.




ID: 756eb825-3364-4cb3-97e4-022c82110401
comments.creator: paul.sep@gmx.de

WFM - Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110401 Firefox/4.2a1pre ID:20110401030438

What Adobe Printer are you using (i.e. Acrobat Pro)? What version (i.e. 9)?

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#Make_a_new_profile

FYI: The text on www.mozilla.org changes so it doesn't always read "we're building a better internet"

FYI: The text on www.mozilla.org changes so it doesn't always read "we're building a better internet"

I use Adobe Creative Suite CS3 and therefore it's Acrobat 8 Pro.

This issue occures also when starting Firefox in Safe Mode.

This is independent of the used profile and I have this issue on different machines, also with a new profile.

What is same on the different machines is, they all run Windows 7 x64 (Ultimate or Professional).

FYI: It doesn't matter, what website I try to print. You can use any website, you want. The point is, when copying text from the website to past it as name for the PDF file, Firefox hangs. When clicking Start // Run and I type any text, copy this text and paste it as filename for the PDF document for the website I want to print, it's working !!!???!!!

That's where I ask myself, whether I'm missing something.

comments.raw_text:
[UPDATE]

I asked a friend of mine, to check, whether he get's the same problem or not.
His system is an Acer TravelMate 7740g, Windows 7 Professional, Adobe Acrobat 10.
When he tries to print a web page to Adobe PDF printer and changes the name by pasting e.g. the former copied headline of the web page as document name, Firefox hangs completely and must be killed from within the task manager.

So it also has nothing to do with the Adobe Acrobat version, because I used Acrobat 8 Pro and he uses Acrobat 10 Pro.

Maybe someone can check, whether this issue also exists on Windows 7 32 bit.

Btw: On Windows XP 32 bit, it's not an issue, it's working correctly.

I honestly cannot remember since it was a month ago, and I nvr had this issue again. All that I can tell you is that I have been getting a slew of crashes and hangs from the plugin container since v6 release.  Up to that release there has never been an issue. There is extensive documentation regarding an issue with the plugin container relating to flash here:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=561019

In the above thread it had to do with exiting leaving the noted pages which caused the errors most all of the time, but as i said its been a month and i didn't really document that error thoroughly 

Although that has to do with flash and the plugin container, i am seeing a the plugin container crashing left and right all over the place. The most common error being the one listed above. 

The plugin container seems to be the issue here, nothing else since the v6 release.

Maybe Mozilla should re-incorporate the v4 plugin container back into the design since v4 was flawless; literally with regards to crashes and hangs of this type. I tried to swap the v4 plugin container with the v7 plugin container and FF didn't like it. I would be more than happy to dump my crash report log in a zip file if necessary.

I am wondering what the feasibility of using the v4 plugin container in future releases from here forward to resolve the extremely ANNOYING issue, if that is the issue.

I am wondering where Mozilla is standing with this plugin container issue overall?
comments.creator: Jupiter1700@gmail.com
comments.author: Jupiter1700@gmail.com

If I understand comment 0, Firefox stops responding, so that doesn't generate a crash report. As a consequence, the hang signature in comment 0 is unrelated to this bug (Flash hang).

I can't reproduce with PDFCreator and Firefox 11. It's probably an Abobe's issue.

comments.text:
Scoobidiver

copy some text of this website and try to print it to PDF-File.
Change the given filename by pasting the former copied text in the filename field.

On Windows 7 x64, Firefox hangs.

Killing the process splwow64.exe bings control back to Firefox, but after that, you'll get an error while trying to print again.
Logout and relogin to Windows will help on that, but will not solve the main problem.

(In reply to Scoobidiver from comment #20)
> If I understand comment 0, Firefox stops responding, so that doesn't
> generate a crash report. As a consequence, the hang signature in comment 0
> is unrelated to this bug (Flash hang).
> 
> I can't reproduce with PDFCreator and Firefox 11. It's probably an Abobe's
> issue.

comments.creator: vorond@gmail.com
comments.text: I am also having this issue for a while including the current version of Firefox version 19.0.2 and Adobe Acrobat X version 10.1.6. This issue can be replicated with Firefox in normal and safe mode with a new profile.
comments.author: vorond@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: I am also having this issue for a while including the current version of Firefox version 19.0.2 and Adobe Acrobat X version 10.1.6. This issue can be replicated with Firefox in normal and safe mode with a new profile.

It's strange that the issue is not clear yet to the developers...
When a text is copied from within Firefox a reference handle is placed in the clipboard, not the text itself.
What's happening is that when the Firefox is printing it is busy, and blocking other calls (Window Messages), so when Paste is requested in the Save As dialog, which appears during Printing, the system will call back Firefox asking to provide the clipboard's contents, but Firefox is already busy and this causes an endless wait because the clipboard does not time-out if the source doesn't respond to provide the information within some time frame.

I don't have a proposed solution, I just hope that I could clarify what's happening technically.
comments.creator: ai_unit@hotmail.com
comments.text:
It's strange that the issue is not clear yet to the developers...
When a text is copied from within Firefox a reference handle is placed in the clipboard, not the text itself.
What's happening is that when the Firefox is printing it is busy, and blocking other calls (Window Messages), so when Paste is requested in the Save As dialog, which appears during Printing, the system will call back Firefox asking to provide the clipboard's contents, but Firefox is already busy and this causes an endless wait because the clipboard does not time-out if the source doesn't respond to provide the information within some time frame.

I don't have a proposed solution, I just hope that I could clarify what's happening technically.
comments.author: ai_unit@hotmail.com
